intro: Arctostaphylos procera, commonly known as the Sierra foothill manzanita, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, woody stems and oval to elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink, which bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a red or orange berry that contains several seeds. Arctostaphylos procera is well adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and woodland habitats.
